What are the twelve?

Fourth, because the work accomplished by diligence can fulfill the intentions of all Buddhas, bodhisattvas should give rise to a greatly courageous mind and practice the perfection of diligence;

Fifth, because diligence can diligently transform and liberate all sentient beings without giving rise to weariness, bodhisattvas should give rise to a greatly courageous mind and practice the perfection of diligence;

Sixth, because diligence can place sentient beings in the Buddhadharma and lead them to the gate of liberation, bodhisattvas should give rise to a greatly courageous mind and practice the perfection of diligence;
Seventh, because diligence can quickly enable all sentient beings to be free from all foolishness, bodhisattvas should give rise to a greatly courageous mind and practice the perfection of diligence;

Twelfth, in order to be able to go to all the Buddha lands, accomplish the unsurpassed path, and turn the great Dharma wheel, bodhisattvas should give rise to a greatly courageous mind and practice the perfection of vigor.
